section.title: mt.mem_alloc
section.para: Allocates the specified number of bytes (debugging/test function).Use b|k|m|g to specify the desired size unit

section.title: mt.mem_free
section.para: Frees the specified number of bytes, previously allocated by one of the other malloc_test functions (e.g. mt.mem_alloc or the script mt_mem_alloc). Use b|k|m|g to specify the desired size unit.Returns the number of bytes freed (can be higher or smaller then the requested size)

section.title: mt.mem_realloc
section.para: Reallocates the specified number of bytes from a pre-allocated randomly selected memory chunk. If no pre-allocated memory chunks exists, it will fail. Make sure mt.mem_used is non 0 or call mt.mem_alloc prior to calling this function. Returns the difference in bytes (<0 if bytes were freed, >0 if more bytes were allocated).Use b|k|m|g to specify the desired size unit

section.title: mt.mem_used
section.para: Returns how many memory chunks and how many bytes are currently allocated via the mem_alloc module functions. Use b|k|m|g to specify the desired size unit.

section.title: mt.mem_rnd_alloc
section.para: Takes 4 parameters: min, max, total_size and an optional unit (b|k|m|g). It will allocate total_size memory, in pieces of random size betweenmin .. max (inclusive).

section.title: mt.mem_test_start
section.para: Takes 7 parameters: min, max, total_size, min_interval, max_interval, test_time and an optional size unit (b|k|m|g). All the time units are ms. It will run a memory allocation test for test_time ms. At a random interval between min_interval and max_interval ms. it will allocate a memory chunk with random size, between min and max. Each time total_size is reached, it will free all the memory allocated and start again.Returns the test id (integer)

section.title: mt.mem_test_stop
section.para: Takes 1 parameter: the test id. It will stop the corresponding test.Note: the test is stopped, but not destroyed.

section.title: mt.mem_test_destroy
section.para: Takes 1 parameter: the test id. It will destroy the corresponding test.

section.title: mt.mem_test_destroy_all
section.para: It will destroy all the tests (running or stopped).

section.title: mt.mem_test_list
section.para: If a test id parameter is provided it will list the corresponding test, else it will list all of them. Use b |k | m | g as a second parameter for the size units (default bytes)
